repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
# Description
This PR fixes the issue with `:checkhealth` not recognizing `g:loaded_python3_provider=1` being set in the config (which leads to erroneous behavior as stated in #30263 ).

P.S: This is my first PR in neovim :confetti_ball: so excuse my silliness (if any) :D

comment_data.body:
comparing `nil` to 1 is valid in Lua

```suggestion
  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider and vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then

comment_data.body: Oh yeah makes sense. Let me push a commit fixing it right now
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider and vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then

@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider and vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then

comment_data.body:
the provider's own code sets 1 here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/95ab723995f1cc1a11c62355fbac64597526d47e/runtime/autoload/provider/python3.vim#L14

is this message going to be shown in that case?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

comment_data.body: Perhaps the provider code should be changed to the set it to 0 instead: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32696#issuecomment-2692714967
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

comment_data.body:
It does detect that loaded_python3_provider being set in the config on my setup (tried it with a new env and pynvim too as https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32696#issuecomment-2694209665 ) without any changes to provider code. 

But what @zeertzjq suggested could probably be a much more long term solution. Then we wouldn't need to check for this special case in ":checkhealth" at all. Makes more sense. Let me know if I should do that. 

Because from the issue thread, they wanted ":checkhealth" to report if loaded_*_provider=1 was being set wrongly.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

comment_data.body: The tests i did were ":echo g:loaded_python3_provider" and ":echo has('python3')" on having the variable set in the config and not. And ":checkhealth" seems to report it properly that it was being set to 2. I wonder if removing the provider still reports it. I will test that right now hold on...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

comment_data.body:
Running ":checkhealth" to check for python3 providers (confirms pynvim is not installed):
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad6aa063-030d-4c39-8695-a41a04e37d5e)

Running ":checkhealth" when variable is set in config:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/83ac34d9-2835-42b3-8b4d-922aed0d68d3)
![2025-03-28_20-25](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/366b37ad-126d-4cc3-9564-44acca6de82c)

Running ":checkhealth" when variable is not set in config:
![2025-03-28_20-26](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe4c2dc6-0d53-4198-91f5-99fb87e2bf3c)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fed3d1c6-1acb-4d4b-b4e6-55c56296b975)

This is on a fresh python venv with no pynvim installed and with the code from the issue branch.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',
+      {
+        'Remove the line `vim.g.loaded_python3_provider=1` from your config or comment it out.',

comment_data.body: Would these checks still need to be done because we are changing the provider code itself?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',
+      {
+        'Remove the line `vim.g.loaded_python3_provider=1` from your config or comment it out.',

@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',
+      {
+        'Remove the line `vim.g.loaded_python3_provider=1` from your config or comment it out.',

comment_data.body:
> Would these checks still need to be done because we are changing the provider code itself?

I think the check is still needed because `1` will behave like `0`, which is not what the user intended?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',
+      {
+        'Remove the line `vim.g.loaded_python3_provider=1` from your config or comment it out.',

comment_data.body: This can be generalized for all the providers. I'll do that in a followup PR. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33168
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,6 +110,16 @@ local function check_config()
     )
   end
 
+  if vim.g.loaded_python3_provider == 1 then
+    ok = false
+    health.error(
+      '`g:loaded_python3_provider=1` may have been set by mistake. This option should not be used to load python provider in your config.',

comment_regular_data.body: This will report an error if the python3 provider is loaded.

Hmm. You might be right actually. I didn't really give much of a thought to that possibility. Is there some way that we could distinguish globals set by the config versus the ones which are not? I wonder.... I'll give it a second thought.

Thanks for pointing that out! <3
Apparently, my local setup sets `g:loaded_python3_provider=2` ? That's weird.
Oh wait, `g:loaded_python3_provider` is set to `1` when loading the python3 provider failed. But `:checkhealth` always has warning for the case providers are unavailable.
So would that mean we'd need to check for setting to `0` instead? The issue OP said that it seemed ok to be set to `0` though hmmm
IDK, perhaps the providers should instead set their `g:loaded_*_provider` variables to `0` instead of `1` when not available, so that setting the variables to `1` is always wrong?
Is it only python that does this :skull:
I wanted to test it out with pyenv like OP said, but silly pip doesn't let me do it XD

I tried setting up a virtualenv with `venv`, installed `pynvim` and then tried setting the necessary config vars. It seems it does recognize `vim.g.loaded_python3_provider` being set in the config. My only thoughts were if I can move this check into the provider health checks in `lua/vim/provider/python.lua` instead. Let me know if that'd make more sense.

I also need to figure out `luals` :p idk how it doesn't see the stylua.toml. Ill push a commit once I figure it out.
Will revisit this after release. I don't have time to carefully look at this. Please keep it rebased / leave a comment after Nvim 0.11 is released.
Yes! Sure ty! Will do (and fix lint errors)

> It does detect that loaded_python3_provider being set in the config on my setup

Irrelevant. The provider itself, under certain conditions, sets `1`. The health logic added in this PR, will be misleading under those conditions.

> Perhaps the provider code should be changed to the set it to 0 instead: [#32696 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32696#issuecomment-2692714967)

`1` means the module was "loaded" but the required program wasn't found. However, that information is not actually used anywhere. So technically we could change all places that set 1, to 0:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/ruby.vim#L14

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/python3.vim#L14

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/perl.vim#L14

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/node.vim#L155

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/clipboard.vim#L287

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/node.vim#L4

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6ef5dd5266822960d254b8acd5ab0934cc2b117e/runtime/autoload/provider/clipboard.vim#L12

Ok, let's make that change. All of this will become simpler once the providers are migrated to Lua...

title: fix: Issue #30263 with :checkhealth.
